cyclone.name: HENRI
cyclone.current_location: about 415 miles SSE of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Henri is forecast to turn north on Friday, then accelerate north-northeast this weekend, tracking toward southern New England while remaining east of the Mid-Atlantic coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern New England (Long Island / Rhode Island area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued yet (watches expected to begin along southern New England on Friday).
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greatly affected coast expected from Long Island, NY eastward to Cape Cod and the southern New England shoreline; lesser impacts possible Outer Banks to Delmarva for surf and rain bands.
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible Sunday into Monday with gusts generally below tropical-storm force (less than 39 mph) — only a 10 % chance of sustained 34 kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal rises of 1–2 ft possible in the Delaware Bay due to distant onshore flow.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands could bring 1–2 inches of rain Sunday–Monday; localized higher amounts possible but 4-inch totals not expected.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and high surf beginning Friday and persisting through the weekend.
